<h1 className={"openapi__heading"}>Download Host Scan Results</h1>

<MethodEndpoint method={"get"} path={"/api/v31.02/hosts/download"}></MethodEndpoint>



```
x-prisma-cloud-target-env: {"permission":"monitorHosts","saas":true,"self-hosted":true}
x-public: true
```



Downloads all host scan reports in CSV format.

This endpoint maps to the CSV hyperlink in **Monitor > Vulnerabilities > Hosts > Running hosts** in the Console UI.

**Note**: The query parameters `fields`, `complianceID` and `normalizedSeverity` are not supported for this API endpoint.

### cURL Request

Refer to the following example cURL command that downloads all host scan reports to a CSV file called `hosts_report.csv`:

```bash
curl -k \
  -u <USER> \
  -H 'Content-Type: text/csv' \
  -X GET -o hosts_report.csv \
  https://<CONSOLE>/api/v<VERSION>/hosts/download
```

A successful response displays the status of the download.


## Request

Offset starts from 0.\n","in":"query","name":"offset","schema":{"type":"integer"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Limit is the amount to fix.\n","in":"query","name":"limit","schema":{"type":"integer"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Sorts the result using a key.\n","in":"query","name":"sort","schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Sorts the result in reverse order.\n","in":"query","name":"reverse","schema":{"type":"boolean"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Filters the result based on hostnames.\n","in":"query","name":"hostname","schema":{"description":"Filters the result based on hostnames.\n","items":{"type":"string","title":"string"},"type":"array"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Filters the result based on OS distribution names.\n","in":"query","name":"distro","schema":{"description":"Filters the result based on OS distribution names.\n","items":{"type":"string","title":"string"},"type":"array"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Provides the minimal image data. Information about vulnerabilities, compliance, and extended image metadata are skipped.\nDefault is false.\n","in":"query","name":"compact","schema":{"type":"boolean"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Filters the result based on cluster names.\n","in":"query","name":"clusters","schema":{"description":"Filters the result based on cluster names.\n","items":{"type":"string","title":"string"},"type":"array"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Filters the result based on compliance IDs.\n","in":"query","name":"complianceIDs","schema":{"description":"Filters the result based on compliance IDs.\n","items":{"type":"integer","title":"int"},"type":"array"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Filters the result based on applied compliance rule name.\n","in":"query","name":"complianceRuleName","schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Retrieves the host names that were scanned by the agentless scanner.\n","in":"query","name":"agentless","schema":{"type":"boolean"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Filters only images scanned by CSA.\n","in":"query","name":"csa","schema":{"type":"boolean"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Retrieves the host names that were skipped during an agentless scan.\nDefault is false.\n","in":"query","name":"stopped","schema":{"type":"boolean"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Retrieves the result in the normalized form of low, medium, high, and critical based on vulnerability's severity level.\nDefault is false.\n","in":"query","name":"normalizedSeverity","schema":{"type":"boolean"}}}></ParamsItem></ul></div></details><div><div><ApiTabs label={undefined} id={undefined}><TabItem label={"200"} value={"200"}><div>

OK
